revised_title: Unearthing Ancient Roman Relics in Hertfordshire
tldr: In 1744, John Ward and William Freeman discovered ancient Roman relics, including a small brass image, an oblong piece of brass, and seven silver plates, in Hertfordshire. The artifacts feature inscriptions and images of Mars and Vulcan, Roman gods associated with war and fire, respectively. These findings provide insight into the Roman presence in the region and the worship of these deities.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
